data.title: The Legend of Bagger Vance
data.meta_description: Novel: The Legend of Bagger Vance: A Novel of Golf and the Game of Life Author: Steven Pressfield Condition: Good Binding: Softcover ISBN: 038072751X Published: 1999
data.meta_site_name: Book Attic - Fill your home with books
data.text:
DESCRIPTION

In the Depression year of 1931, on the golf links at Krewe Island off Savannah’s windswept shore, two legends of the game—Bobby Jones and Walter Hagen—meet for a mesmerizing thirty-six-hole showdown. Another golfer will also compete—a troubled local war hero, once a champion, who comes with his mentor and caddie, the mysterious Bagger Vance. It is Vance, sage and charismatic, who will ultimately guide the match, for he holds the secret of the Authentic Swing. And he alone can show his protege the way back to glory.

Condition Guideline

Excellent: Might show some creases on the spine, no hard cracks. Pages are clean with no discoloration.

Very Good: Pages will show small signs of discoloration. Spine will have slight creases.

Good: Pages might be slightly discolored. Spines will show signs of creases. Dust jacket might have a small tear.

Fair: Pages will be discolored. Spines will show signs of creases. Dust jacket might have a tear.

Some books might contain stickers or stamps, creases from folding corners or an inscription.

We rarely sell poor condition books, unless the books are in demand and difficult to find in a better condition.
